H2: Optimizers in SciPy,Optimizing Functions,Roots of an Equation,Minimizing a Function,Finding Minima
All_para:
Optimizers are a set of procedures defined in SciPy that either find the minimum value of 
a function, or the root of an equation.,Essentially, all of the algorithms in Machine Learning are nothing more than a complex equation that needs to be minimized with the help of given data.,NumPy is capable of finding roots for polynomials and linear equations, but it can not find roots for , 
linear equations, like this one:,For that you can use SciPy's , function.,This function takes two required arguments:, - a function representing an equation., - an initial guess for the root.,The function returns an object with information regarding the solution.,The actual solution is given under attribute , 
of the returned object:,A function, in this context, represents a curve, curves have , and ,.,High points are called ,.,Low points are called ,.,The highest point in the whole curve is called ,, whereas the rest of them are called ,.,The lowest point in whole curve is called ,, whereas the rest of them are called ,.,We can use , function to minimize the function.,The , function takes the following arguments:, - a function representing an equation., - an initial guess for the root., - name of the method to use. H2: Working with Spatial Data,Triangulation,Convex Hull,KDTrees,Distance Matrix,Euclidean Distance,Cityblock Distance (Manhattan Distance),Cosine Distance,Hamming Distance
All_para:
Spatial data refers to data that is represented in a geometric space.,E.g. points on a coordinate system.,We deal with spatial data problems on many tasks.,E.g. finding if a point is inside a boundary or not.,SciPy provides us with the module ,, which has 
functions for working with 
spatial data.,A Triangulation of a polygon is to divide the polygon into multiple
triangles with which we can compute an area of the polygon.,A Triangulation , means creating surface composed triangles in which all
of the given points are on at least one vertex of any triangle in the surface.,One method to generate these triangulations through points is the , Triangulation.,A convex hull is the smallest polygon that covers all of the given points.,Use the , method to create a Convex Hull.,KDTrees are a datastructure optimized for nearest neighbor queries.,E.g. in a set of points using KDTrees we can efficiently ask which points are nearest to a certain given point.,The , method returns a KDTree object.,The , method returns the distance to the nearest neighbor , 
the location of the neighbors.,There are many Distance Metrics used to find various types of distances between two points in data science, Euclidean distsance, cosine distsance etc.,The distance between two vectors may not only be the length of straight line between them,
it can also be the angle between them from origin, or number of unit steps required etc.,Many of the Machine Learning algorithm's performance depends greatly on distance metrices.
E.g. "K Nearest Neighbors", or "K Means" etc.,Let us look at some of the Distance Metrices:,Find the euclidean distance between given points.,Is the distance computed using 4 degrees of movement.,E.g. we can only move: up, down, right, or left, not diagonally.,Is the value of cosine angle between the two points A and B.,Is the proportion of bits where two bits are difference.,It's a way to measure distance for binary sequences.

H2: What is Statistical Significance Test?,T-Test,KS-Test,Statistical Description of Data,Normality Tests (Skewness and Kurtosis)
All_para:
In statistics, statistical significance means that the result that was produced has a reason behind it, it was not produced randomly, or by chance.,SciPy provides us with a module called ,, which has functions for performing statistical significance tests.

,Here are some techniques and keywords that are important when performing such tests:,Hypothesis is an assumption about a parameter in population.,It assumes that the observation is not statistically significant.,It assumes that the observations are due to some reason.,Its alternate to Null Hypothesis.,For an assessment of a student we would take:, - as a null hypothesis,
and:, - as an alternate hypothesis.,When our hypothesis is testing for one side of the value only, it is called "one tailed test".,For the null hypothesis:,we can have alternate hypothesis:, or:,When our hypothesis is testing for both side of the values.,For the null hypothesis:,we can have alternate hypothesis:,In this case the mean is less than, or greater than k, and both sides are to be checked.,Alpha value is the level of significance.,How close to extremes the data must be for null hypothesis to be rejected.,It is usually taken as 0.01, 0.05, or 0.1.,P value tells how close to extreme the data actually is.,P value and alpha values are compared to establish the statistical significance.,If p value <= alpha we reject the null hypothesis and say that the data is statistically significant.
otherwise we accept the null hypothesis.,T-tests are used to determine if there is significant deference between means of two variables.
and lets us know if they belong to the same distribution.,It is a two tailed test.,The function , takes two samples of same size and produces a tuple of t-statistic and p-value.,If you want to return only the p-value, use the , property:,KS test is used to check if given values follow a distribution.,The function takes the value to be tested, and the CDF as two parameters.,It can be used as a one tailed or two tailed test.,By default it is two tailed. We can pass parameter alternative as a string of one of two-sided, less, or greater.,In order to see a summary of values in an array, we can use the , function.,It returns the following description:,Normality tests are based on the skewness and kurtosis.,The , function returns p value for the null hypothesis:,.,A measure of symmetry in data.,For normal distributions it is 0.,If it is negative, it means the data is skewed left.,If it is positive it means the data is skewed right.,A measure of whether the data is heavy or lightly tailed to a normal distribution.,Positive kurtosis means heavy tailed.,Negative kurtosis means lightly tailed.

H2: What is Interpolation?,How to Implement it in SciPy?,1D Interpolation,Spline Interpolation,Interpolation with Radial Basis Function
All_para:
Interpolation is a method for generating points between given points.,For example: for points 1 and 2, we may interpolate and find points 1.33 and 1.66.,Interpolation has many usage, in Machine Learning we often deal with missing data in a dataset,
interpolation is often used to substitute those values.,This method of filling values is called ,.,Apart from imputation, interpolation is often used where we need to smooth the discrete points in 
a dataset.,SciPy provides us with a module called ,
which has many functions to deal with interpolation:,The function , is used to interpolate a distribution with 1 variable.,It takes , and , points and returns
a callable function that can be called with new , and returns corresponding ,.,In 1D interpolation the points are fitted for a , whereas in Spline interpolation
the points are fitted against a , function defined with polynomials called splines.,The , function takes
, and ,
and produce a callable funciton that can be called with new ,.
,Radial basis function is a function that is defined corresponding to a fixed reference point.,The , function also takes , and ,
as arguments and produces a callable function that can be called with new ,.

H2: What is SciPy?,Why Use SciPy?,Which Language is SciPy Written in?,Where is the SciPy Codebase?
All_para: SciPy is a scientific computation library that uses , underneath.,SciPy stands for Scientific Python.,It provides more utility functions for optimization, stats and signal processing.,Like NumPy, SciPy is open source so we can use it freely.,SciPy was created by NumPy's creator Travis Olliphant.,If SciPy uses NumPy underneath, why can we not just use NumPy?,SciPy has optimized and added functions that are frequently used in NumPy and Data Science.,SciPy is predominantly written in Python, but a few segments are written in C.,The source code for SciPy is located at this github repository

You can test your SciPy skills with W3Schools' Exercises.,We have gathered a variety of SciPy exercises (with answers) for each SciPy Chapter.,Try to solve an exercise by filling in the missing parts of a code.
If you're stuck, hit the "Show Answer" button to see what you've done wrong.,You will get 1 point for
each correct answer. Your score and total score will always be displayed.
